intro: Eremostachys baissunensis var. cana, commonly known as the white-flowered eremostachys, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, hairy leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its thick, fleshy stems. Its flowers, which range from white to pale pink, bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This variant is distinguished by its pale coloration compared to other forms of Eremostachys baissunensis.
